main.name: Thomas Harrison
main.description: I have been working in Technology for the past six years at Travelers Insurance. During the first four years in their Technology Leadership Developement Program (TLDP), I had rotational roles as a Project Manager, Security Architect, Software Engineer, and DevOps Engineer. I am now in my current role of DevOps Engineer/Product Manager
main.bio: Tech enthusiast who enjoys reading, playing D&D with friends, breweries, and traveling the world.

testimonials.text: Who the hell is Tom Harrison and how did you get past security?

education.description: Member of Delta Sigma Pi, a business fraternity focused on professional development, networking and community service. Was also Jonathan the Husky, UConn's mascot.

work.title: DevOps Engineer & Product Manager
work.description: Determine stategic priorities for DevOps organization when it comes to AppDev support, automation, and self-service capabilities. Also highly engaged in the enterprise initiative of Software Engineering Excellence - elevating our Software Engineering tooling and practices.

work.title: Technology Leadership Development Program
work.description: Rotational Program that provided the opportunity to experience a breadth of roles. Also took part in internal committees responsible for recruiting and interviewing interns, charity fundraising through hosting a golf tournament, and technology education.

work.title: Software Engineer
work.description: Worked as Javascript developer for our Customer Identity and Access Managment group. Organized and facilitated Developer Coaching Sessions to educate engineers about systems, architecture, and technologies leveraged by Travelers.

work.title: Security Architect
work.description: Conducted security reviews for the procurement of third-party technologies and created app security and tech governance guidelines. Assessed multiple CASB(Cloud Access Security Broker) offerings and provided vendor selection recommendation to Cybersecurity leadership.

work.title: Scrum Master
work.description: Facilitated meetings and agile ceremonies for team. Removed blockers and implemented process improvements through the analysis of Agile metrics. Managed the project budget to align with scope through resource allocations.
